page.title: 01ASPULL AND NEW SPRINGS
page.content: The area known as Aspull and New Springs,is an area to the North and East of the township of Wigan in Lancashire. This block also contains parts of Higher Ince and Hindley. Historically the area is one of the cradles of the Industrial Revolution A with a corner of the family estate of the Earl of Balcarres, now Haigh Hall country park at the North West Corner of the block,and the site of the Kirkless Iron Works at the western side of the block. Aspull was a mining village and there are still mine shafts today. Many of the names of the pits have changed over the time. One of the original mine owners was called Woodshaw and we now have a reclaimed spoil heap called Woodshaws. There are rows of pit cottages in the village.
